column1: StxLocation 0=penile, 1=bulbar, 2= membranous/posterior, 3=panurethral, 4= penobulbar, 5= bulbomembranous, 6 = pars fixa
column3: Type of Urethroplasty 1 = augmented with BMG inlay or onlay, 2= onlay with flap, 3 = Augmented anastomosis with graft, 4= anastomotic (any type), 5=combined/other
Tissue Transfer 0=no, 1=yes BMG, 2= yes tunica dartos(vaginalis) flap, 3=yes combined graft/flap, 4= PIF, 5= other
column5: 90d Clavien II or higher Complication? (N=0, Yes=1)

column3: Type of Urethroplasty (1=EPA/variant; 2=graft, BMG; 3=flap; 4=2stage/urethrostomy; 5=multiple different approaches; 6=other)
column5: Cystoscopy – patent at 12-18 months  0=no (BAD), 1= not done, 2= yes (good)

column1: Stx Length (cm) based on urethrogram/OR note , the biggest
column3: 1 or 2 Stage Procedure (could change to 0 and 1)
column5: Time to Failure or Follow-up (months) (surgery to failure)

column4: Cystoscopy – patent at 12-18 months  0=no (BAD), 1= not done, 2= yes (good)

column1: Preop Comorbidities (use Charlson's comorbidity scale, see Sheet 3)
column4: Time to Failure or Follow-up (months) (surgery to failure)

column2: UTI or Abcess? 0 = no; 1 = yes; 2 = unknown
column4: 90d Clavien II or higher Complication? (N=0, Yes=1)

column3: Suprapubic Catheter Postop (if they had one before OR 2nd stage)
column4: 90d Clavien Grade– Clavien I-1, Clavien II-2, Clavien IIIa=3, Clavien IIIb=4, Clavien IVa=5, Clavien IVb=6, Clavien V=7)

90d Type of significant complication. 0=Wound (infection, abscess, hematoma), 1=UTI treated (uti, epididymitis, etc.), 2=Catheter-related 3=Hematuria requiring catheter change, surgery, admission, etc, 4=Acute urinary retention after catheter removal, 5=cardiovascular, 6=pulmonary, 7=Other

90d Type of any complication (categorized) (0=Wound (infection, abscess, hematoma), 1=UTI treated (uti, epididymitis, etc.), 2=Catheter-related – catheter change, dislodged and came out, etc), 3=Hematuria requiring treatment (requiring catheter change, surgery, admission, etc.), 4=Acute urinary retention after catheter removal, 5=cardiovascular, 6=pulmonary, 7=Other)
90d Clavien Grade (I will use the updated Clavien dindo classification as attached) – Clavien I-1, Clavien II-2, Clavien IIIa=3, Clavien IIIb=4, Clavien IVa=5, Clavien IVb=6, Clavien V=7)

column1: Prior Endoscopic procedures (None=0, One-two=1, Three-Five=2, Greater than 5=3)

column4: Complication Type 0=minor wound, 1=minor foley/AUR , 2=surgical require intervention 3= minor medical 4=major medical
ED 0=no, 1=yes no change fr preop, 2=ED worse postop 3=ejac dys
Erectile dysfunction (change or new at 5-6mos and/or 12mos)
LUTS other than PVD (0 = no, 1 = yes)
Persisting LUTS at 6mos other than PVD (yes/no)
